author: Special Correspondent
text:
No nation could grow without the active involvement of teachers: V-C

S. Subbiah, Vice Chancellor of Alagappa University exhorted the faculty to teach cultural richness of the country to the students, produce vibrant, mentally and physically strong youth and help them face challenges in their career.

Inaugurating the two-day international conference on “Health Indicators for Physical and Cognitive Fitness Education” organised by the university’s faculty of education here on Friday, he said besides teaching academics, teachers should strive to produce ‘emotionally balanced and socially adjustable’ students to help them face challenges in life. “In future, students will become great educationists, scientists, politicians and administrators and they need mental fitness right from student days and it depends on the teaching and guiding ability of the teachers,” he said.

Teachers should also teach and guide students on spirituality and tolerance, truth and non-violence, complexity of social growth and scientific advancements, he said.

Apart from helping students to excel in academics, teachers should provide sufficient opportunities to the students to equip their thinking skills, he also added.
title: Call to produce mentally strong youth
